member.name: T:Geodesy.Angle
member.summary: Encapsulation of an Angle. Angles are constructed and serialized in degrees for human convenience, but a conversion to radians is provided for mathematical calculations. Angle comparisons are performed in absolute terms - no "wrapping" occurs. In other words, 360 degress != 0 degrees.

member.name: F:Geodesy.Angle.PiOver180
member.summary: Degrees/Radians conversion constant.

member.name: F:Geodesy.Angle.Zero
member.summary: Zero Angle

member.name: F:Geodesy.Angle.Angle180
member.summary: 180 degree Angle

member.name: P:Geodesy.Angle.Degrees
member.summary: Get/set angle measured in degrees.

member.name: M:Geodesy.Angle.#ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: Construct a new Angle from a degree measurement.

member.name: M:Geodesy.Angle.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Construct a new Angle from degrees and minutes.
member.param: minutes portion of angle measurement (0 <= minutes < 60)
member.exception: Raised if the minutes are not in range

member.name: M:Geodesy.Angle.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Construct a new Angle from degrees, minutes, and seconds.
member.param: minutes portion of angle measurement (0 <= minutes < 60)
seconds portion of angle measurement (0 <= seconds < 60)
member.exception: Raised if the minutes or seconds are not in range

member.name: P:Geodesy.Angle.Radians
member.summary: Get/set angle measured in radians.

member.name: M:Geodesy.Angle.CompareTo(Geodesy.Angle)
member.summary: Compare this angle to another angle.
member.returns: result according to IComparable contract/>

member.name: M:Geodesy.Angle.DegToRad(System.Double)
member.summary: Convert degrees to radians
member.returns: Radians

member.name: M:Geodesy.Angle.RadToDeg(System.Double)
member.summary: Convert radians to degrees
member.returns: Degrees

member.name: M:Geodesy.Angle.Abs
member.summary: Get the absolute value of the angle (in degrees).

member.summary: Calculate a hash code for the angle.
member.returns: hash code

member.name: M:Geodesy.Angle.Equals(Geodesy.Angle)
member.summary: Compare this Angle to another Angle for equality. Angle comparisons are performed in absolute terms - no "wrapping" occurs. In other words, 360 degress != 0 degrees.
member.returns: 'true' if angles are equal

member.name: M:Geodesy.Angle.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Compare this Angle to another Angle for equality. Angle comparisons are performed in absolute terms - no "wrapping" occurs. In other words, 360 degress != 0 degrees.
member.returns: 'true' if angles are equal

member.name: M:Geodesy.Angle.ToString
member.summary: Get coordinates as a string. This string is always culture invariant.
member.returns: The angle as a culture invariant string

member.summary: Subtract two angles
member.returns: The difference of the angles

member.summary: Multiply an angle with a number
member.returns: The angle multiplied by the number

member.summary: Multiply an angle with a number
member.returns: The angle multiplied by the number

member.summary: Test whether an angle is greater than another one

member.summary: Test whether an angle is less than another one
member.returns: True if the left operand angle is less than the right operand angle

member.summary: Test whether an angle is less than or equal another one

member.summary: Construct a new Ellipsoid. This is private to ensure the values are consistent (flattening = 1.0 / inverseFlattening). Use the methods FromAAndInverseF() and FromAAndF() to create new instances.

member.summary: Build an Ellipsoid from the semi major axis measurement and the flattening.

member.name: T:Geodesy.GeodeticCalculator
member.summary: Implementation of Thaddeus Vincenty's algorithms to solve the direct and inverse geodetic problems. For more information, see Vincent's original publication on the NOAA website: See http://www.ngs.noaa.gov/PUBS_LIB/inverse.pdf

member.name: P:Geodesy.GeodeticCalculator.ReferenceGlobe
member.summary: The reference Ellipsoid to use for the calculations

member.name: M:Geodesy.GeodeticCalculator.#ctor(Geodesy.Ellipsoid)
member.summary: Instantiate a calculator for the specified reference Ellipsoid

member.name: M:Geodesy.GeodeticCalculator.CalculateEndingGlobalCoordinates(Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates,Geodesy.Angle,System.Double,Geodesy.Angle@)
member.summary: Calculate the destination and final bearing after traveling a specified distance, and a specified starting bearing, for an initial location. This is the solution to the direct geodetic problem.
member.returns: The coordinates of the final location of the traveling

member.name: M:Geodesy.GeodeticCalculator.CalculateEndingGlobalCoordinates(Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates,Geodesy.Angle,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate the destination after traveling a specified distance, and a specified starting bearing, for an initial location. This is the solution to the direct geodetic problem.
member.returns: The coordinates of the final location of the traveling

member.name: M:Geodesy.GeodeticCalculator.CalculateGeodeticCurve(Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates,Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates)
member.summary: Calculate the geodetic curve between two points on a specified reference ellipsoid. This is the solution to the inverse geodetic problem.
member.returns: The geodetic curve information to get from start to end

member.name: M:Geodesy.GeodeticCalculator.CalculateGeodeticMeasurement(Geodesy.GlobalPosition,Geodesy.GlobalPosition)
member.summary: Calculate the three dimensional geodetic measurement between two positions measured in reference to a specified ellipsoid. This calculation is performed by first computing a new ellipsoid by expanding or contracting the reference ellipsoid such that the new ellipsoid passes through the average elevation of the two positions. A geodetic curve across the new ellisoid is calculated. The point-to-point distance is calculated as the hypotenuse of a right triangle where the length of one side is the ellipsoidal distance and the other is the difference in elevation.
member.returns: The geodetic measurement information to get from start to end

member.name: M:Geodesy.GeodeticCalculator.CalculateGeodeticPath(Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates,Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates,System.Int32)
member.summary: Compute a geodetic path from start to end witha given number of points
member.param: Number of points on the path (including start and end)
member.exception: Thrown if the number of points is less than 2
member.returns: An array of points describing the path from start to end

member.name: M:Geodesy.GeodeticCalculator.Equals(Geodesy.GeodeticCalculator)
member.summary: Test another calculator to be equal to this one
member.returns: True if they are the same (means have the same reference globe)

member.name: T:Geodesy.GeodeticCurve
member.summary: This is the outcome of a geodetic calculation. It represents the path and ellipsoidal distance between two GlobalCoordinates for a specified reference ellipsoid.

member.name: P:Geodesy.GeodeticCurve.EllipsoidalDistance
member.summary: Ellipsoidal distance (in meters).

member.name: P:Geodesy.GeodeticCurve.Calculator
member.summary: The calculator used to compute this curve

member.name: P:Geodesy.GeodeticCurve.Azimuth
member.summary: Get the azimuth. This is angle from north from start to end.

member.name: M:Geodesy.GeodeticCurve.#ctor(Geodesy.GeodeticCalculator,System.Double,Geodesy.Angle)
member.summary: Create a new GeodeticCurve.
member.param: The calculator used to compute this curve

member.name: P:Geodesy.GeodeticCurve.ReverseAzimuth
member.summary: Get the reverse azimuth. This is angle from north from end to start.

member.name: M:Geodesy.GeodeticCurve.ToString
member.summary: Get curve as a culture invariant string.
member.returns: The parameters describing the curve as culture invariant string

member.name: M:Geodesy.GeodeticCurve.Equals(Geodesy.GeodeticCurve)
member.summary: Test another curve for equality
member.returns: True if they are the same

member.name: T:Geodesy.GeodeticMeasurement
member.summary: This is the outcome of a three dimensional geodetic calculation. It represents the path a between two GlobalPositions for a specified reference ellipsoid.

member.name: P:Geodesy.GeodeticMeasurement.Calculator
member.summary: The calculator used to compute this measurement

member.name: P:Geodesy.GeodeticMeasurement.AverageCurve
member.summary: Get the average geodetic curve. This is the geodetic curve as measured at the average elevation between two points.

member.name: P:Geodesy.GeodeticMeasurement.EllipsoidalDistance
member.summary: Get the ellipsoidal distance (in meters). This is the length of the average geodetic curve. For actual point-to-point distance, use PointToPointDistance property.

member.name: P:Geodesy.GeodeticMeasurement.Azimuth
member.summary: Get the azimuth. This is angle from north from start to end.

member.name: P:Geodesy.GeodeticMeasurement.ReverseAzimuth
member.summary: Get the reverse azimuth. This is angle from north from end to start.

member.name: P:Geodesy.GeodeticMeasurement.ElevationChange
member.summary: Get the elevation change, in meters, going from the starting to the ending point.

member.name: P:Geodesy.GeodeticMeasurement.PointToPointDistance
member.summary: Get the distance travelled, in meters, going from one point to the next.

member.name: M:Geodesy.GeodeticMeasurement.#ctor(Geodesy.GeodeticCurve,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of GeodeticMeasurement.
member.param: the geodetic curve as measured at the average elevation between two points
the change in elevation, in meters, going from the starting point to the ending point

member.summary: Get the GeodeticMeasurement as a culture invariant string
member.returns: The measurement as culture invariant string

member.name: M:Geodesy.GeodeticMeasurement.Equals(Geodesy.GeodeticMeasurement)
member.summary: Test wether another measurement is the same
member.returns: True if both are the same

member.name: T:Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates
member.summary: Encapsulation of latitude and longitude coordinates on a globe. Negative latitude is southern hemisphere. Negative longitude is western hemisphere. Any angle may be specified for longtiude and latitude, but all angles will be canonicalized such that: -90 <= latitude <= +90 -180 < longitude <= +180

member.name: F:Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates._mLatitude
member.summary: Latitude. Negative latitude is southern hemisphere.

member.name: F:Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates._mLongitude
member.summary: Longitude. Negative longitude is western hemisphere.

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates.#ctor(Geodesy.Angle,Geodesy.Angle)
member.summary: Construct a new GlobalCoordinates. Angles will be canonicalized.

member.name: P:Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates.Latitude
member.summary: Get/set latitude. The latitude value will be canonicalized (which might result in a change to the longitude). Negative latitude is southern hemisphere.

member.name: P:Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates.Longitude
member.summary: Get/set longitude. The longitude value will be canonicalized. Negative longitude is western hemisphere.

member.name: P:Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates.Antipode
member.summary: The coordinates of the Antipode of this point

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates.CompareTo(Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates)
member.summary: Compare these coordinates to another set of coordiates. Western longitudes are less than eastern logitudes. If longitudes are equal, then southern latitudes are less than northern latitudes.
member.returns: -1, 0, or +1 as per IComparable contract

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates.Canonicalize
member.summary: Canonicalize the current latitude and longitude values such that: -90 <= latitude <= +90 -180 < longitude <= +180

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates.IsApproximatelyEqual(Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates,System.Double)
member.summary: Test whether or not another coordinate is close to this coordinate within a defined precision.
member.param: The coordinates of the ther place
The precsion (optional, defaults to some small value)
member.returns: True if the places are close to each other

member.summary: Compare these coordinates to other coordinates for equality

member.summary: Compare these coordinates to another object for equality.
member.returns: True if they are the same

member.summary: Test whether two GlobalCoordinates are not the same

member.returns: An array of points describing the loxodromic path from start to end

member.name: T:Geodesy.GlobalMesh
member.summary: This class overlays the globe with a mesh of squares. The algorithm is based on subdividing the UTM grids into finer cell structures, so the coverage is for latitudes between 80° South and 84° North.

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalMesh.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Instantiate the Mesh with the given nuber of meters as the size of the mesh squares. We do not support squares less than 1m. Please note that the actual mesh size used is a derived value that approximates the requested mesh size in order to provide better computational efficiency.
member.param: The size of the squares in meter. The defauklt value is 1000m.
member.exception: Raised if an invalid mesh size is specified

member.name: P:Geodesy.GlobalMesh.MeshSize
member.summary: The size of the mesh squares in meters. We only support full meters.

member.name: P:Geodesy.GlobalMesh.Projection
member.summary: The UTM Projection for the Globe we cover with the mesh.

member.name: P:Geodesy.GlobalMesh.Count
member.summary: The (maximum) total number of meshes used to cover an UTM Grid. Individual Grids may actually be covered by fewer mesh-cells.

member.name: P:Geodesy.GlobalMesh.GlobalCount
member.summary: The maximum number of a mesh

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalMesh.Grid(System.Int64)
member.summary: Return the UtmGrid this mesh belongs to
member.returns: The UtmGrid in which this mesh cell is located
member.exception: Raised if an invalid mesh number is specified

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalMesh.MeshNumber(Geodesy.UtmCoordinate)
member.summary: Get the globally unique Mesh number of a coordinate
member.returns: The mesh number to which the coordinate belongs

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalMesh.MeshNumber(Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates)
member.summary: Get the globally unique Mesh number of a location given by latitude and longitude.
member.returns: The mesh number to which the location belongs

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalMesh.MeshNumber(Geodesy.Angle,Geodesy.Angle)
member.summary: Get the globally unique Mesh number of a location given by latitude and longitude.
member.returns: The mesh number to which the location belongs

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalMesh.CenterOf(System.Int64)
member.summary: Return the central coordinates of a Mesh given by its number. Please note that this center is on the UTM map, but at the borders of a grid this coordinate may actually overlap and belong to another UTM grid. So if you convert them to a Latitude/Longitude and then back to an UtmCoordinate, you may get different values.
member.returns: The UTM coordinates of the center of the square
member.exception: Raised if an invalid mesh number is specified

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalMesh.LowerLeft(System.Int64)
member.summary: Return the lower left corner coordinates of a Mesh given by its number. Please note that this point is on the UTM map, but at the borders of a grid this coordinate may actually overlap and belong to another UTM grid. So if you convert them to a Latitude/Longitude and then back to an UtmCoordinate, you may get different values.
member.returns: The UTM coordinates of the lower left corner of the Mesh
member.exception: Raised if an invalid mesh number is specified

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalMesh.LowerRight(System.Int64)
member.summary: Return the lower right corner coordinates of a Mesh given by its number. Please note that this point is on the UTM map, but at the borders of a grid this coordinate may actually overlap and belong to another UTM grid. So if you convert them to a Latitude/Longitude and then back to an UtmCoordinate, you may get different values.
member.returns: The UTM coordinates of the lower right corner of the Mesh
member.exception: Raised if an invalid mesh number is specified

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalMesh.UpperLeft(System.Int64)
member.summary: Return the upper left corner coordinates of a Mesh given by its number. Please note that this point is on the UTM map, but at the borders of a grid this coordinate may actually overlap and belong to another UTM grid. So if you convert them to a Latitude/Longitude and then back to an UtmCoordinate, you may get different values.
member.returns: The UTM coordinates of the upper left corner of the Mesh
member.exception: Raised if an invalid mesh number is specified

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalMesh.UpperRight(System.Int64)
member.summary: Return the upper right corner coordinates of a Mesh given by its number. Please note that this point is on the UTM map, but at the borders of a grid this coordinate may actually overlap and belong to another UTM grid. So if you convert them to a Latitude/Longitude and then back to an UtmCoordinate, you may get different values.
member.returns: The UTM coordinates of the upper right corner of the Mesh
member.exception: Raised if an invalid mesh number is specified

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalMesh.Neighborhood(System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the list of neighbor meshes in a specified "distance". Distance 1 means direct neighbors, 2 means neighbors that are 2 meshes away etc.
member.returns: The list of mesh numbers of the neighbors
member.exception: Raised if an invalid mesh number is specified

member.name: T:Geodesy.GlobalPosition
member.summary: Encapsulates a three dimensional location on a globe (GlobalCoordinates combined with an elevation in meters above a reference ellipsoid).

member.name: F:Geodesy.GlobalPosition._mCoordinates
member.summary: Global coordinates.

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalPosition.#ctor(Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of GlobalPosition.
member.param: elevation, in meters, above the reference ellipsoid.

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalPosition.#ctor(Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of GlobalPosition for a position on the surface of the reference ellipsoid.

member.name: P:Geodesy.GlobalPosition.Coordinates
member.summary: Get/set global coordinates.

member.name: P:Geodesy.GlobalPosition.Latitude
member.summary: Get/set latitude.

member.name: P:Geodesy.GlobalPosition.Longitude
member.summary: Get/set longitude.

member.name: P:Geodesy.GlobalPosition.Elevation
member.summary: Get/set elevation, in meters, above the surface of the reference ellipsoid.

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalPosition.CompareTo(Geodesy.GlobalPosition)
member.summary: Compare this position to another. Western longitudes are less than eastern logitudes. If longitudes are equal, then southern latitudes are less than northern latitudes. If coordinates are equal, lower elevations are less than higher elevations
member.returns: -1, 0, or +1 as per IComparable contract

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalPosition.GetHashCode
member.summary: Calculate a hash code.

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalPosition.Equals(Geodesy.GlobalPosition)
member.summary: Compare this position to another position for equality
member.returns: true if both are equal

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalPosition.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Compare this position to another object for equality.
member.returns: true if the obj is a GlobalPosition and is the same.

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalPosition.ToString
member.summary: Get position as a culture invariant string.
member.returns: The position as culture invariant string

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalPosition.op_Equality(Geodesy.GlobalPosition,Geodesy.GlobalPosition)
member.summary: Test two GlobalPositions for equality
member.returns: True if they are the same

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalPosition.op_Inequality(Geodesy.GlobalPosition,Geodesy.GlobalPosition)
member.summary: Test two GlobalPositions for equality
member.returns: True if they are the same

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalPosition.op_LessThan(Geodesy.GlobalPosition,Geodesy.GlobalPosition)
member.summary: Test whether a GlobalPosition is smaller than another one
member.returns: True if the first position is smaller than the second

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalPosition.op_LessThanOrEqual(Geodesy.GlobalPosition,Geodesy.GlobalPosition)
member.summary: Test whether a GlobalPosition is smaller or equal than another one
member.returns: True if the first position is smaller than or equal to the second

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalPosition.op_GreaterThan(Geodesy.GlobalPosition,Geodesy.GlobalPosition)
member.summary: Test whether a GlobalPosition is greater than another one
member.returns: True if the first position is greater than the second

member.name: M:Geodesy.GlobalPosition.op_GreaterThanOrEqual(Geodesy.GlobalPosition,Geodesy.GlobalPosition)
member.summary: Test whether a GlobalPosition is greater or equal than another one
member.returns: True if the first position is greater than or equal to the second

member.name: T:Geodesy.MercatorProjection
member.summary: Base class for Mercator projections tranlating longitude/longitude values on the globe into X/Y coordinates on a flat map.

member.name: F:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.GreenwichMeridian
member.summary: The typical reference Meridian

member.name: M:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.#ctor(Geodesy.Ellipsoid)
member.summary: Instantiate a Meractor projection with this reference Ellipsoid

member.name: P:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.ReferenceMeridian
member.summary: The reference meridian for the projection, usually this is Greenwich with 0° longitude

member.name: P:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.ReferenceGlobe
member.summary: The reference Ellipsoid for this projection

member.name: M:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.ScaleFactor(Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates)
member.summary: Get the Mercator scale factor for the given point
member.returns: The scale factor

member.name: M:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.ToEuclidian(Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates)
member.summary: Convert a latitude/longitude coordinate to a Euclidian coordinate on a flat map
member.returns: The euclidian coordinates of that point

member.name: M:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.FromEuclidian(Geodesy.EuclidianCoordinate)
member.summary: Get the latitude/longitude coordinates from the euclidian coordinates
member.returns: The latitude/longitude coordinates of that point

member.name: M:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.Equals(Geodesy.MercatorProjection)
member.summary: Two projections are considered Equal if they are based on the same Reference-Globe
member.returns: True if they are equal

member.name: P:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.MaxLatitude
member.summary: Maximum possible longitude for this projection

member.name: P:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.MinLatitude
member.summary: Minimum possible longitude for this projection

member.name: F:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.MaxLongitude
member.summary: Maximum possible longitude for this projection

member.name: F:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.MinLongitude
member.summary: Minimum possible longitude for this projection

member.name: M:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.NormalizeLatitude(Geodesy.Angle)
member.summary: Ensure Latitude stays in range
member.returns: The normalized longitude

member.name: M:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.NormalizeLongitude(Geodesy.Angle)
member.summary: Ensure Latitude stays in range
member.returns: The normalized longitude

member.name: M:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.EuclidianDistance(Geodesy.EuclidianCoordinate,Geodesy.EuclidianCoordinate)
member.summary: Compute the euclidian distance between two points given by rectangular coordinates Please note, that due to scaling effects this might be quite different from the true geodetic distance. To get a good approximation, you must divide this value by a scale factor.
member.returns: The distance between the points
member.exception: Raised if the two points don't belong to the same projection
Raised if one of the points is null

member.name: M:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.EuclidianDistance(Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates,Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates)
member.summary: Compute the euclidian distance between two points given by rectangular coordinates. Please note, that due to scaling effects this might be quite different from the true geodetic distance. To get a good approximation, you must divide this value by a scale factor.
member.returns: The distance between the points

member.name: M:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.EuclidianDistance(System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Compute the euclidian distance between two points given by rectangular coordinates Please note, that due to scaling effects this might be quite different from the true geodetic distance. To get a good approximation, you must divide this value by a scale factor.
member.returns: The distance between the points
member.exception: Raised if one of the arrays is not two-dimensional

member.name: M:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.GeodesicDistance(Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates,Geodesy.GlobalCoordinates)
member.summary: Get the geodesic distance between two points on the globe
member.returns: The distance in meters

member.name: M:Geodesy.MercatorProjection.GeodesicDistance(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Compute the geodesic distance of two points on the globe
member.param: The longitude of the starting point in degrees
The longitude of the starting point in degrees
The longitude of the endig point in degrees
The longitude of the ending point in degrees

member.name: T:Geodesy.Properties.Resource
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.COORD_ARRAY_MUST_BE_2DIM
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A coordinate array must have exactly two elements..

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.GEODETIC_PATH_MIN_2
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A geodetic path must have at least two points..

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.GRID_EXCEPTION
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The UTM grids 32X,34X and 36X are not assigned..

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.INVALID_BAND
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Invalid UTMBand specified..

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.INVALID_DISTANCE
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Invalid distance.

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.INVALID_LATITUDE
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The UTM projection ownly allows latitudes from -80° to +84°.

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.INVALID_MESH_NUMBER
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The mesh number is invalid.

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.INVALID_ORDINAL
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The ordinal number of the Grid is invalid..

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.INVALID_ZONE
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Invalid UTM Zone specified.

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.MESHSIZE_MIN_VIOLATION
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The mesh size must be at least 1 meter..

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.MESHSIZE_TOO_BIG
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The mesh size is to big, it doesn't divide all UTMGrids into multiple cells..

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.MINSEC_0_TO_60
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Minutes or seconds must have a value between 0 and 60..

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.NEGATIVE_DISTANCE
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Distance cannot be negative..

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.NO_NORTH_NEIGHBOR
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The grid is in the most northern band, there is no northern neighbor..

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.NO_SOUTH_NEIGHBOR
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The grid is in the most southern band, there is no southern neighbor..

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.NO_UNIQUE_NORTH_NEIGHBOR
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The UTM grid has no unique northern neighbor (exceptionoal grids in northern hemisphere).

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.NO_UNIQUE_SOUTH_NEIGHBOR
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The UTM grid has no unique southern neighbor (exceptionoal grids in northern hemisphere).

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.NO_UTM_COORDINATE
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The coordinate must be an _UtmCoordinate..

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.POINT_NOT_OWNED
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The euclidian coordinate does not belong to this projection..

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.POINT_NOT_SAME_PROJECTION
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The euclidian coordinates do not belong to the same projection..

member.name: P:Geodesy.Properties.Resource.PROJECTION_NULL
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The projection argument must not be null..

member.name: T:Geodesy.SphericalMercatorProjection
member.summary: This is the Mercator projection assuming the earth is a perfect sphere. It's less exact, but the math is slightly easier and thus faster.

member.summary: Instantiate a spherical Mercator projection

member.returns: The longitude (in degrees)

member.summary: Convert the longitude (n degrees) to an Y-coordinate (in meters) on a Mercator map
member.returns: The Y coordinate in meters

member.name: T:Geodesy.UtmGrid
member.summary: The globe is partioned into Grids by the UTM projection. This structure represents such a grid.

member.name: F:Geodesy.UtmGrid.NumberOfZones
member.summary: The number of (horizontal) zones

member.name: F:Geodesy.UtmGrid.NumberOfBands
member.summary: The number of (vertical) bands.

member.name: F:Geodesy.UtmGrid.NumberOfGrids
member.summary: The theoretical number of UTM Grids on the globe. Actually there are fewer ones, because there are exceptions.

member.name: F:Geodesy.UtmGrid.NumberOfUsedGrids
member.summary: The number of UTM Grids really used. There are 3 potential combinations in the X-Band that are an exception and not used (32X, 34X, 36X)

member.name: F:Geodesy.UtmGrid.Xstep
member.summary: Horizontal stepwidth for the Grids

member.name: F:Geodesy.UtmGrid.Ystep
member.summary: Vertical stepwidth for the Grids

member.summary: Instantiate a new UTM Grid object
member.param: The UTM projection this grid belongs to
member.exception: Thrown if zone or band are requested
Thrown if the projection is null

member.summary: Height of the Grid (as an Angle)

member.name: P:Geodesy.UtmGrid.Ordinal
member.summary: Unique numbering of the Grids. The most western, most southern gets #0. Then we go north continue counting, when reaching the northern limit we go to the lowest south of the next zone to the east of the current one.

member.summary: Return true is this is a northern band
